intro: Tephrosia ibityensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. The plant is adapted to the dry and humid conditions of its native habitat, showing resilience to varying environmental stresses.
